questions.text: Drug of choice for ventricular tachycardia after MI is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Lignocaine

Highyeild:

Lidocaine's major effect is on sodium channels in fast-response fibers such as ventricular muscle and Purkinje fibres. Lidocaine effectively targets ischemic areas of the heart. Ischemic cells will be depolarized, and Na channels will be inactivated. So, Lignocaine targets this state of the Na channel and prolongs this state in ischemic cells without affecting normal myocardial cells. So, arrhythmias arising from the ischemic zone are stopped. That’s why it is the DOC in Ventricular tachycardia with MI.

questions.text: Among the following options, the mechanism of action of digitalis is:

options.text: Active metabolites are produced in the liver

Inhibits Na+K+atpase pump

questions.text: The mechanism of action of digitalis in atrial fibrillation is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Due to vagomimetic action

Highyeild:

The mechanism of action of digitalis in atrial fibrillation is: Due to vago mimetic action of digitalis Increase in refractoriness of AV nodal tissue So that the impulses arising from atrial are not conducted to ventricles and prevent the ventricle from being continuously stimulated Digoxin can control ventricular rate in AF and AFL, whether associated with CHF or not. Still, it cannot cure the arrhythmia, i.e., it does not revert it to sinus rhythm. Often, AFL may be converted into AF because digoxin abbreviates atrial ERP and makes it more inhomogeneous. Digoxin reduces the ventricular rate in AF and afl by decreasing the number of impulses that can pass down the A-V node and bundle of His. It increases ERP of the A-V node by direct, vagomimetic, and antiadrenergic actions: The minimum interval between consecutive impulses that can successfully traverse the conducting tissue is prolonged.
